author: Reuters Editorial
title: Dollar index holds gains as Wall Street opens higher
text:
NEW YORK (Reuters) - The dollar clung to its earlier gains against a basket of currencies on Friday as Wall Streetâ€™s major indexes opened higher a day after a massive sell-off knocked the Dow and S&P 500 down into correction territory.
At 9:41 a.m. (1441 GMT), the index that tracks the greenback against six major currencies .DJI were up 0.18 percent at 90.394,
The Dow .DJI was up 0.75 percent at 24,039.50, while the S&P .SPX was up 0.78 percent at 2,601.24.
Reporting by Richard LeongEditing by Chizu Nomiyama
